item.title: Close this please
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

I commented on this but it got deleted. Okay.

Silly boy, this is client-sided. You’re missing the interfaces/buttons/text.

Open your RSInterface class and take out the clanChatTab method. Post it here.

Read full topic

item.title: Close this please
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

The interfaces won’t do anything if they’re not coded into your server correctly…

Just make a few simple commands to get the clan chat rolling, then you can think of implementing that with the actual interfaces, and get the clans set up.

::clanjoin
::clanmake
::clandelete

etc…

Read full topic

item.title: Close this please
item.dc:creator: @ezzi ezzi
item.description:
@ezzi wrote:

[quote=“Host Gushers, post:8, topic:472308”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=590055.msg4179400#msg4179400 date=1355345933]

     if (c.clanId != -1)
          c.clanId = -1;
               c.sendMessage("You are not in a clan.");
          }
          return;
     }

[/quote]

Dont u also have to add pictures of it in your cache>sprite>interfaces>Clan Chat?[/quote]
You could try making an interface, like a tabInterface or something not sure if that’s what it’s called and add it in RSInterface.java and add your sprites to your sprites folder.

Read full topic

item.title: Close this please
item.dc:creator: @makersprivate123 makersprivate123
item.description:
@makersprivate123 wrote:

[quote=“iBunnie, post:2, topic:472308”][quote author=makersprivate123 link=topic=590055.msg4177669#msg4177669 date=1355171927]
Hello!
What I need help with is what the title says!
This is how my commands.java base looks like, the first lines.

@Override public void processPacket(Client c, int packetType, int packetSize) { String playerCommand = c.getInStream().readString(); if(Config.SERVER_DEBUG) Misc.println(c.playerName+" playerCommand: "+playerCommand); if (playerCommand.startsWith("/") && playerCommand.length() > 1) { if (c.clanId >= 0) { String clanName; System.out.println(playerCommand); playerCommand = playerCommand.substring(1); Server.clanChat.playerMessageToClan(c.playerId, playerCommand, c.clanId); clanName = Server.clanChat.getClanName(c.clanId); Chat.writeChatLog(Chat.getDate("time") + "["+clanName+"]" + Chat.getRank(c) + Misc.formatPlayerName(c.playerName) +": " + playerCommand, "ClanChat"); } else { if (c.clanId != -1) c.clanId = -1; c.sendMessage("You are not in a clan."); } return; }
Whenever I try to do a command, I get “You are not in a clan.”…

Then I need the clan thingy…
This is how it looks like…

Dj3vp.png765×503

…
[/quote]
Why’s your clan chat so messed up? Isnt this erasedpkz?[/quote]
No, project insanity. I found a clean one on rune-server.o*g and he didn’t name it… it is a 317 but changed client.

Read full topic
